intro: Anemia ulbrichtii, commonly known as the Ulbricht's anemone, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other similar species. The plant features showy, radially symmetrical flowers with five to eight petals, typically in shades of white or pale yellow. Its leaves are palmately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. Anemia ulbrichtii thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes.
